newsitem.title: USA: Maryland tourism industry grows to $5 bln a year.
newsitem.headline: Maryland tourism industry grows to $5 bln a year.

text.p: Tourism has become Maryland's third largest industry, employing 50,000 people and generating more than $5 billion annually, Gov Parris Glendening said Wednesday.
The tourism industry contributes $365 million annually in state and local taxes.
Glendening made the remarks in a statement lauding the Route 13 Tourist Information Center in Wicomico County, which has attracted 22,000 visitors since it opened in May.

The 6,000-square-foot center was built as a public-private partnership with a $50,000 grant from the Maryland Board of Public Works, another $50,000 from the State Highway Administration, and $748,000 Wicomico County.

"The tourism industry is a major provider of family-supporting jobs and tax revenue in Maryland, and the assistance that this center provides to tourists will help the growth of this important industry," Glendening said.
